radiographic_examinations.findings: mass in the right middle lobe and a right pleural effusion

homogeneous opacity (5.8 cm by 4.9 cm) extending from the pleura to the hilum, interlobular septal thickening in the right middle lobe, mediastinal and right hilar lymphadenopathy, and a loculated right pleural effusion
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The loculated right pleural effusion was larger than that seen on the previous scan.

radiographic_examinations.findings: mass in the right middle lobe, atelec-tasis in both lower lobes, and a loculated right pleural effusion
mass in the right middle lobe, patchy left basilar opacity consistent with atelectasis, stable right pleural effusion, and moderate left pleural effusion
new bilateral subpleural ground-glass and reticular opacities, subpleural nodular consolidation in the left lower lobe, and consolidation in the medial right lung around the bronchial stump
right superior labral tear with surrounding inflammatory change and a left adnexal cyst; no evidence of fracture or osteonecrosis
decrease in the size of the pulmonary consolidation and complete normalization of the previously inflamed iliac vessels
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The size of the pulmonary consolidation decreased over time.
